title: Kourtney Kardashian’s cheeky son Reign, four, flips the bird in Armenia
text:
Kourtney’s son may want to Reign it in (Pictures: Instagram)

Kourtney Kardashian’s son Reign didn’t exactly have the warmest greeting for the paparazzi while out in Armenia yesterday, as he was seen swearing at the cameras.

The Kardashian family continued their jaunt around their father’s ancestral country on Wednesday, where Kim’s youngest children were baptised last week.

It seems Reign didn’t appreciate all the attention though as he made a rather rude gesture at the cameras.

A photo shared by a Kardashian fan account shows the four-year-old smiling while flipping the bird towards the camera as his mum Kourtney carries him through the large crowd of fans.

He might want to Reign it in a little.

Kourtney shares Reign with her former partner Scott Disick, and they are also parents to eldest son Mason, nine, and daughter Penelope, seven.

A recent episode of Keeping Up With the Kardashians featured a huge argument between Kris Jenner’s boyfriend Corey Gamble and Scott over his children’s behaviour.

In the divisive conversation, Corey said of Penelope: ‘If P scratch me, I’m whipping her a**.’

Scott shouted back: ‘My daughter? My little daughter?! … Don’t ever talk about a child like that!’

Kourtney was also furious with Corey’s comment and later said: ‘Because he will never be with my kids alone and if he does that in front of any of us there will be a f***ing issue!’

In a confessional interview, Corey then explained: ‘I understand how Kourtney and Scott feel but I can say what I want to say because that’s my opinion. I hope that everyone is able to move on.’

The tension later simmered when Corey and Kourtney had a heart-to-heart.

Kourtney, 40, later reiterated that she is against beating or smacking children as punishment.

‘In my opinion, beating children is not [how] to “get your kids in check. When children are hurting or frustrated, the answer is not to physically hurt them [sic],’ she tweeted.

The Kardashians are certainly making the most of their trip to Armenia as they enjoyed a swanky dinner with President Armen Sarkissian at the presidential palace.
